arguments.-l: Show detailed information (permissions, owner, size, etc.)
arguments.-h: Display human-readable file sizes (e.g., KB, MB, GB)

arguments.path: The directory to change to (e.g., cd /home/user or cd .. to go up one level)

arguments.directory_name: The name of the directory to create
The name of the directory to remove

arguments.source: The file or directory to copy
arguments.destination: The location to copy the file or directory to

arguments.source: The file or directory to move/rename
arguments.destination: The new name or location for the file/directory

arguments.-r: Recursively delete directories and their contents (use with caution!)

arguments.permission_mode: A string representing the new permissions (e.g., chmod 755 filename)

man.description: Get help on a specific command (e.g., man ls)

arguments.command_name: The name of the command you want help with

arguments.file: The file to display contents for

arguments.hostname_or_IP: The hostname or IP address to ping

arguments.username@hostname: The username and hostname of the remote server (e.g., ssh user@server.com)

scp.description: Secure copy files to/from remote server

arguments.source: The file or directory to copy
arguments.destination: The location to copy the file or directory to (on the remote server)

ps.arguments: Often used with flags like -a (show all processes) or -e (show environment variables for processes)

arguments: No arguments needed, but can be used with flags for specific information

arguments.process_id: The ID of the process to terminate (use ps to find process IDs)
